Provisioning k8s cluster with Ansible and Kops on AWS

Read before proceding:

  1. What is ansible
  2. What is kubernetes
  3. What is Kops

So, we are gonna write ansible scripts to provision k8s with the help of kops.

The code is here 

k8s-ansible/
├── ansible.cfg
├── cluster.conf.d
├── create-cluster.yaml
├── delete-cluster.yaml
├── group_vars
├── inventory
├── kops-clusters
├── README.md
├── roles
├── utils
└── validate-cluster.yaml

Create cluster

---
- include_role:
    name: base

- name: "Create cluster "
  shell: >
    kops create cluster 
    --cloud-labels="Team=MyTeam"
    --admin-access=<to be changed>/32
    --kubernetes-version=
    --zones=
    --dns-zone=
    --master-count=
    --master-size=
    --master-volume-size=
    --cloud=aws
    --output yaml
    --state=s3://
    --node-size=
    --node-count=
    --node-volume-size=
    --topology=public
    --encrypt-etcd-storage
    --networking=canal
- name: "Apply extra confs on cluster"
  shell: >
    ./utils/genClusterConfig.py
    --cluster-name=
    --cluster-state=s3://
    --conf-path=cluster.conf.d
    --output=./tmp-.yaml
    &&
    kops replace --name  --state=s3:// -f ./tmp-.yaml
    &&
    rm -f ./tmp-.yaml
- name: "Apply extra confs on nodes"
  shell: >
    ./utils/genClusterConfig.py
    --cluster-name=
    --cluster-state=s3://
    --conf-path=nodes.conf.d
    --component=ig
    --output=./tmp--nodes.yaml
    &&
    kops replace --name  --state=s3:// -f ./tmp--nodes.yaml
    &&
    rm -f ./tmp--nodes.yaml
- name: "Apply extra confs on master"
  shell: >
    ./utils/genClusterConfig.py
    --cluster-name=
    --cluster-state=s3://
    --conf-path=master.conf.d
    --component=master-
    --output=./tmp--master-.yaml
    &&
    kops replace --name  --state=s3:// -f ./tmp--master-.yaml
    &&
    rm -f ./tmp--master-.yaml
  with_items: ""
  loop_control:
    index_var: index
  when: index < master_count

- name: "Apply plan creation for cluster "
  shell: >
    kops update cluster
    --name 
    --state=s3://
    --yes
